abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the South West Indian
            Ocean Fisheries Project for Africa are to: (i) identify and
            study exploitable offshore fish stocks within the project
            area, and differentiate between environmental and
            anthropogenic impacts on shared fisheries; (ii) develop
            institutional and human capacity through training and career
            building. Budget reallocation is necessary mainly to reflect
            properly illustrate the regional nature of expenses incurred
            by the project and reduce unnecessary administrative
            procedures and to, in a lesser extent, reflect changes in
            means of implementation. Main change in categories is in the
            consultant services, that increase slightly to reflect needs
            for more consultant time than expected during November 2011
            restructuring. The consultants services budget remains
            however low compared to initial budget, increasing from
            $1,669,190.33 to $1,822,530.54 compared to $2,827,700 before
            November 2011 restructuring, since regional collaboration
            and arrangements permit direct implementation by the staff
            of participating institutions with limited use of
            consultants' support.
